item.title: Chapter 19: The Central Role of Carbon Prices
item.description: Climate-change policy is a tale of two sciences. The natural sciences have done an admirable job of describing the geophysical aspects of climate change. The science behind global warming is well established. While the timing and regional effects of the changes are not known with certainty, natural scientists have persuasively shown that unchecked CO2 emissions will have dangerous consequences. But understanding the natural science of climate change is only the first step.
